definition: used when you are not certain that something will happen or that something is true or is a correct number
used when making a suggestion
used when replying to a question or an idea, especially when you are not sure whether to agree or disagree
possibly
used when you want to make a statement or opinion less definite
used when making a rough estimate
used when you agree or accept something unwillingly, or do not want to say that you think something is bad
used when making a polite request, offer or suggestion
perhaps
used to say that something might exist, happen or be true, but you are not certain
used with can/could to emphasize that you are surprised, annoyed, etc. about something
used with could to ask somebody politely to do something
used with can/could to say that somebody will do or has done as much as they can in order to make something happen
used with negatives, especially can't/couldn't, to say strongly that you cannot do something or that something cannot or could not happen or be done
feeling angry or unhappy because somebody you like or love is showing interest in somebody else
feeling angry or unhappy because you wish you had something that somebody else has
wanting to keep or protect something that you have because it makes you feel proud
wanting to be in the same situation as somebody else; wanting something that somebody else has
to avoid giving a direct answer to a question in order to hide the truth
a dry, flat cake with a pattern of squares on both sides, often eaten with sweet sauce, cream, etc. on top
language that uses a lot of words but does not say anything important or interesting
a type of plant that grows in hot countries and produces very small seeds. The seeds are used as food, mainly to make flour, and also to feed to birds and animals.
the fact of being too proud of yourself and what you do
an artistic effect or device, especially one that is very clever or tries to be very clever but does not succeed
a clever expression in writing or speech that involves a comparison between two things
a computer program that lets you look at or read documents on the World Wide Web
a person who looks through books, magazines, etc. or at things for sale, but may not seriously intend to buy anything
pleasure and enthusiasm
the quality of being exciting, interesting and fun
the outer skin of an orange, a lemon, etc., when it is used in cooking
medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person’s body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment
a place where a doctor, dentist or vet sees patients
the time during which a doctor, dentist or vet is available to see patients
a time when people can meet their Member of Parliament to ask questions and get help
the study and use of different types of radiation in medicine, for example to treat diseases
a person who hates or dislikes women or believes they are not as good as men
a person who hates and avoids other people
a doctor who is trained in radiology
a large, brightly coloured spring flower, like a cup in shape, on a tall stem
a plant grown for its grain that is used for making food, beer and whisky; the grains of this plant
a tall yellow spring flower that is like a trumpet in shape. It is a national symbol of Wales.
small dark seed that is grown as food for animals and for making flour
a child’s word for a dog

a website where an individual person, or people representing an organization, write regularly about recent events or topics that interest them, usually with photos and links to other websites that they find interesting

a website where an individual person, or people representing an organization, write regularly about recent events or topics that interest them, usually with photos and links to other websites that they find interesting
an amount that is greater than is needed or can be used
a speech or a piece of writing that argues very strongly for or against something/somebody
the practice or skill of arguing strongly for or against something/somebody
a way of speaking or writing that makes something sound better, more exciting, more dangerous, etc. than it really is
any of the numbers from 0 to 9
a finger, thumb or toe
an official order given by a court that demands that something must or must not be done
a warning or an order from somebody in authority
a small soft round fruit with shiny red or black skin and a large seed inside
a tree on which cherries grow, or a similar tree, grown for its flowers
the wood of the cherry tree
a bright red colour
an opportunity to do something
a type of small whale
a type of large fish that lives in rivers and lakes in eastern Europe
a type of caviar (= fish eggs), from a beluga
a large wild animal of the cow family that is covered with hair. There are two types of bison, the North American (also called buffalo) and the European.
the scientific study of sight and light
the way in which an action or event is seen and understood by the public
a short piece of writing by a student as part of a course of study
a short piece of writing on a particular subject, written in order to be published
an attempt to do something
a garden plant with bunches of purple flowers with a sweet smell
the flowers of the lavender plant that have been dried, used for making sheets, clothes, etc. smell nice
a pale purple colour
a person whose job is to examine people’s eyes and to recommend and sell glasses
a person whose job is to make and supply glasses, but who does not test people's eyes
the shop where an optician works
a person who makes lenses, glasses, etc.
the study and treatment of mental illnesses
used in the past to show that somebody is surprised or annoyed
a short pin with a large round, flat head, used especially for fastening paper to a board or wall
a task that you do regularly
an unpleasant or boring task
just beginning to form and therefore not clear or developed
a fully grown male horse, especially one that is used for breeding (= producing young)
a doctor who studies pathology and examines dead bodies to find out the cause of death
a doctor who studies and treats mental illnesses
a female horse or donkey
a nightmare (= an experience that is very frightening and unpleasant, or very difficult to deal with)
a discovery that seems interesting but is found to have no value
a very complicated situation
a horse that has been castrated
to give or send somebody so many things that they cannot deal with them all
to cover an area of land with a large amount of water
a person whose job is to sing, dance or perform for people so that they enjoy themselves
a piece of work that somebody has to do, especially a hard or unpleasant one
an activity that is designed to help achieve a particular learning goal, especially in language teaching
to criticize somebody strongly for something they have done
a group of things put together in no particular order or arrangement; the fact of putting things together in this way
a scientist who studies the earth's atmosphere and its changes, used especially in predicting what the weather will be like
a very strong wind that moves very fast in circles and causes a lot of damage
a situation or series of events where a lot of things happen very quickly
a king or queen
an old British gold coin worth one pound
a word or phrase that reads the same backwards as forwards, for example madam or nurses run
to make somebody do something by giving them good reasons for doing it
to make somebody believe that something is true
giving out light when heated
very bright
full of strong emotion; extremely angry
so hot that it looks white
very strong and intense
so hot that it looks red
showing strong feeling
new, exciting and of great interest to people
used to describe the person, animal or team that is considered almost certain to win a race, etc.
the act of persuading somebody to do something or to believe something
a particular set of beliefs, especially about religion or politics
of the type mentioned
the dropping of the last sound or sounds of a word, for example when cup of tea becomes cuppa tea
the study of the history and theory of music
a traditional Jewish object to hold seven or nine candles
